span.span: Represents a set of values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供高性能的设置操作。The class provides high-performance set operations. 集是不包含重复元素的集合, 其元素无特定顺序。A set is a collection that contains no duplicate elements, and whose elements are in no particular order. > [!NOTE] > 实现从开始[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]的接口; 在以前版本的 .NET Framework 中, 类未实现此接口。 implements the interface starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]; in previous versions of the .NET Framework, the class did not implement this interface. 对象的容量是对象可以容纳的元素数。The capacity of a object is the number of elements that the object can hold. 当向对象添加元素时,对象的容量会自动增加。A object's capacity automatically increases as elements are added to the object. 类基于数学集的模型, 并提供高性能集操作, 类似于访问或集合的键。 The class is based on the model of mathematical sets and provides high-performance set operations similar to accessing the keys of the or collections. 简而言之, 可以将类视为没有值的集合。In simple terms, the class can be thought of as a collection without values. 集合未进行排序, 并且不能包含重复元素。A collection is not sorted and cannot contain duplicate elements. 如果顺序或元素复制比应用程序的性能更重要, 请考虑结合 使用类和方法。If order or element duplication is more important than performance for your application, consider using the class together with the method. 提供了许多数学集操作, 如设置加法 (union) 和 set 减法。 provides many mathematical set operations, such as set addition (unions) and set subtraction. 下表列出了提供的操作及其数学等效项。The following table lists the provided operations and their mathematical equivalents. |HashSet 操作HashSet operation|数学等效项Mathematical equivalent| |-------------------------------|-----------------------------| ||Union 或 set 加法Union or set addition| ||交集Intersection| ||设置减法Set subtraction| ||对称差异Symmetric difference| 除了列出的 set 操作, 类还提供一些方法, 用于确定设置相等性、集的重叠量, 以及集是另一个集的子集还是超集。In addition to the listed set operations, the class also provides methods for determining set equality, overlap of sets, and whether a set is a subset or superset of another set. **仅 .NET Framework:** 对于非常大的对象, 可以通过在运行时环境中`enabled`将[``](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/gcallowverylargeobjects-element.md)配置元素的属性设置为`true` , 来将64位系统上的最大容量增加到2000000000个元素。**.NET Framework only:** For very large objects, you can increase the maximum capacity to 2 billion elements on a 64-bit system by setting the `enabled` attribute of the [``](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/gcallowverylargeobjects-element.md) configuration element to `true` in the run-time environment. 从开始[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] , 类实现接口。 Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the class implements the interface. ## HashSet 和 LINQ Set 运算HashSet and LINQ Set Operations LINQ `Distinct`为实现`Intersect` `Except` `Union`或接口的任何数据源提供对、和 set 操作的访问。 LINQ provides access to the `Distinct`, `Union`, `Intersect` and `Except` set operations on any data source that implements the or interfaces. 提供了更大、更可靠的集合操作集合。 provides a larger and more robust collection of set operations. 例如, 提供和等比较。For example, provides comparisons such as and . Linq set 操作和操作之间的主要区别在于, linq set 操作始终返回新集合, 而等效方法修改当前集合。The primary difference between LINQ set operations and operations is that LINQ set operations always return a new collection, whereas the equivalent methods modify the current collection. 通常情况下, 如果您必须创建新的集或您的应用程序只需要访问所提供的 set 操作, 则对任何集合或数组使用 LINQ set 操作都足够了。Typically, if you must create a new set or if your application needs access only to the provided set operations, using LINQ set operations on any collection or array will be sufficient. 但是, 如果你的应用程序需要访问其他设置操作, 或者如果不需要或不需要创建新集合, 请使用类。However, if your application requires access to additional set operations, or if it is not desirable or necessary to create a new collection, use the class. 下表显示了操作及其等效的 LINQ set 操作。The following table shows the operations and their equivalent LINQ set operations. |HashSet 操作HashSet operation|LINQ 等效项LINQ equivalent| |-------------------------------|---------------------| ||| ||| ||| |未提供。Not provided.|| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何合并两个不同的集。The following example demonstrates how to merge two disparate sets. 此示例将创建两个对象, 并分别用偶数和奇数填充它们。This example creates two objects, and populates them with even and odd numbers, respectively. 第三个对象是从包含偶数的集创建的。A third object is created from the set that contains the even numbers. 然后, 该示例调用方法, 这会将奇数设置为第三个集。The example then calls the method, which adds the odd number set to the third set. remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象的容量是对象可以容纳的元素数。The capacity of a object is the number of elements that the object can hold. 当向对象添加元素时,对象的容量会自动增加。A object's capacity automatically increases as elements are added to the object. 如果`collection`包含重复项, 则该集将包含每个唯一元素中的一个。If `collection` contains duplicates, the set will contain one of each unique element. 不会引发异常。No exception will be thrown. 因此, 结果集的大小与的大小`collection`并不完全相同。Therefore, the size of the resulting set is not identical to the size of `collection`. 此构造函数是一个 O`n`() 运算, `n`其中是`collection`参数中的元素数目。This constructor is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is the number of elements in the `collection` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何从现有集创建集合。The following example shows how to create a collection from an existing set. 在此示例中, 创建了两个分别具有偶数和奇数的集。In this example, two sets are created with even and odd integers, respectively. 然后, 从偶数整数集创建第三个对象。A third object is then created from the even integer set. A object for the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks C#`for each`语句( C++在VisualBasic中)隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。`For Each` `foreach`The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此, 建议`foreach`使用, 而不是直接操作枚举器。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置, 属性未定义。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此, 在读取的 值之前, 必须调用方法, 以将枚举器前进到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用之前 , 属性将返回相同的对象。The property returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合的末尾, 则枚举器将定位在集合中最后一个元素之后, 并返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时, 对的后续调用也将返回。 `false`When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用返回`false`, 则未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 不能再次将设置为集合的第一个元素; 必须改为创建新的枚举器对象。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator object instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改 (如添加、修改或删除元素), 则枚举器将失效且不可恢复, 并且对或的下一个调用将引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法为 O (1) 操作。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 空集是任何其他集合的正确子集。An empty set is a proper subset of any other collection. 因此, 如果当前`true` 对象表示的集合为空, 则此方法返回, 除非`other`该参数也为空集。Therefore, this method returns `true` if the collection represented by the current object is empty unless the `other` parameter is also an empty set. 如果`other` `false` 大于或等于中的元素数,则此方法始终返回。This method always returns `false` if is greater than or equal to the number of elements in `other`. 如果由表示`other`的集合是具有与当前对象相同的相等比较器的集合, 则此方法为 O (`n`) 运算。If the collection represented by `other` is a collection with the same equality comparer as the current object, then this method is an O(`n`) operation. 否则, 此`n`方法为 O ( + `m`) 运算, 其中`n`为 , `m`为中`other`的元素数。Otherwise, this method is an O(`n` + `m`) operation, where `n` is and `m` is the number of elements in `other`. ## Examples 下面的示例创建两个不同的对象, 并将它们相互比较。The following example creates two disparate objects and compares them to each other. 在此示例中`lowNumbers` , 是一个子集和一个正确的`allNumbers`子集, `allNumbers`直到使用方法修改后, 才能只包含同时存在于这两个集中的值。In this example, `lowNumbers` is both a subset and a proper subset of `allNumbers` until `allNumbers` is modified, using the method, to contain only values that are present in both sets. 和完全相同, 仍然`lowNumbers`是的子集`allNumbers` , 但不再是正确的子集。 `lowNumbers` `allNumbers`Once `allNumbers` and `lowNumbers` are identical, `lowNumbers` is still a subset of `allNumbers` but is no longer a proper subset. remarks.format: ## Remarks C#`for each`语句( C++在VisualBasic中)隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。`For Each` `foreach`The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置, 属性未定义。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此, 在读取的 值之前, 必须调用方法, 以将枚举器前进到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用之前 , 属性将返回相同的对象。The property returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合的末尾, 则枚举器将定位在集合中最后一个元素之后, 并返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时, 对的后续调用也将返回。 `false`When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用返回`false`, 则未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 不能再次将设置为集合的第一个元素; 必须改为创建新的枚举器对象。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator object instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法为 O (1) 操作。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是 O (`n`) 运算, 其中`n`是`other`参数中的元素数目。This method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is the number of elements in the `other` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何合并两个不同的集。The following example demonstrates how to merge two disparate sets. 此示例将创建两个对象, 并分别用偶数和奇数填充它们。This example creates two objects, and populates them with even and odd numbers, respectively. 第三个对象是从包含偶数的集创建的。A third object is created from the set that contains the even numbers. 然后, 该示例调用方法, 这会将奇数设置为第三个集。The example then calls the method, which adds the odd number set to the third set.
